News Flash

Municipal Election Day is May 2, 2026 ‚Äî Here‚Äôs What to Know

City Secretary Posted on January 22, 2026 | Last Updated on January 22, 2026

Hamilton, it‚Äôs time to make your voice heard! The City of Hamilton Municipal Election is coming up on Saturday, May 2, 2026, and voters will help shape the future of our community.

This election will include:

  • Mayor (2-year term)

  • Three City Council positions: one unexpired term and two 2-year terms

Where to Vote

All voting will take place at:

Hamilton City Hall
200 E Main St.
Hamilton, TX 76531

Election Day Hours

Saturday, May 2, 2026
üïñ 7:00 a.m. ‚Äì 7:00 p.m.

If you plan to vote on Election Day, City Hall will be open all day‚Äîcome when it‚Äôs convenient for you.

Early Voting Dates & Times

Want to vote early? Early voting runs:

April 20 ‚Äì April 28, 2026

Mon‚ÄìThurs: 7:30 a.m. ‚Äì 5:00 p.m.
Fri: 8:00 a.m. ‚Äì 12:00 p.m.

Early voting is a great option if you‚Äôll be busy on May 2‚Äîor if you just like getting it done ahead of time.

Important Deadlines

Candidate Filing Period

If you‚Äôre interested in running for office, the filing period is:

January 14 ‚Äì February 13, 2026
City Hall hours for filing:
Mon‚ÄìThurs: 7:30 a.m. ‚Äì 5:00 p.m.
Fri: 8:00 a.m. ‚Äì 12:00 p.m.

Last Day to Register to Vote

To vote in the May election, you must be registered by:

‚úÖ April 2, 2026

Qualifications for Mayor & City Council

Candidates for Mayor or City Council must:

  • Be a U.S. citizen

  • Have lived in Texas for at least 1 year

  • Have lived in Hamilton for at least 6 months

  • Be a qualified voter in the State of Texas

Need to Register or Update Your Address?

To register to vote or change your address, contact:

Terry Short
Hamilton County Tax Assessor-Collector
üìû 254-386-1200

Remember: April 2, 2026, is the deadline to register in time to vote in this municipal election.

  • Election Calendar (PDF)
  • Notice of Municipal Election
  • Application for Ballot by Mail (PDF)
  • Drawing for a Place on Ballot - Results of Drawing for Place on Ballot
  • Notice of Voting Order Priority for Voters with Certain Disabilities (PDF)
